title: With Mideast Deal, Trump Is on the Brink of a Major Diplomatic Accomplishment
summary: For President Trump, success in brokering a cease-fire is the ultimate test of his self-described goal as a deal maker and a peacemaker.

title: What We Know About the Remaining Hostages in Gaza
summary: Israel says that there are still about 20 living hostages in Gaza, along with the bodies of around 25 others. Details of their release remain unclear.

title: Texas’ Blue-State Deployments Shred Relations Between Governors
summary: State leaders have prided themselves on finding bipartisan consensus, but President Trump’s deployment of National Guard troops from Texas to Illinois has ripped the veneer off that image.

title: Before Trump Ordered in Troops, Federal Officers Called Portland Protests ‘Low Energy’
summary: Oregon officials say the atmosphere outside an ICE building that has drawn daily demonstrations since June has grown worse since the president’s threats.

title: Rutgers Expert on Antifa Tries to Flee to Spain After Death Threats
summary: Mark Bray was teaching courses on antifascism. Turning Point USA accused of him belonging to antifa, which he denies. His flight to Spain was canceled abruptly on Wednesday night.

title: Candidates for N.J. Governor Clash Over Opioids, Trump and Taxes
summary: Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican nominee, and Representative Mikie Sherrill, the Democrat, described starkly different visions for the state in a debate Wednesday.

title: G.O.P. Blocks Bid to Halt Trump’s Attacks in the Caribbean Sea
summary: Republicans in the Senate blocked a measure that would terminate the president’s legally disputed campaign targeting alleged drug runners.

title: Qatar Pushes U.S.-Venezuela Diplomacy as Trump Focuses on Military Action
summary: The Pentagon has deployed 10,000 U.S. troops to the region, most of them to bases in Puerto Rico, a senior military official said.

title: ‘Les Misérables’ at 40: The Unlikely Story of a Hit
summary: Critics initially panned it, but public love for the musical with songs like “One Day More” and “On My Own” has kept it going strong for four decades — and counting.

title: Katie Porter Goes Viral for ‘Unhappy’ TV Interview in California Governor’s Race
summary: The former Democratic congresswoman, known for her own grilling of executives on Capitol Hill, threatened to abandon an interview after she was asked several follow-up questions.

title: In Germany’s Depressed East, Tanks Are the Lesser of Two Evils
summary: Even leaders from the far-right Alternative for Germany party, which opposes aid to Ukraine, have embraced the jobs that come with new weapons production.

title: Chinese Surgeons Perform First Pig-to-Human Liver Transplant
summary: The transplanted portion of the genetically modified pig liver was removed after 38 days, and the patient, who had advanced liver cancer and cirrhosis, died several months later.

title: Jonathan Rinderknecht Arrested in Connection With Palisades Fire in Los Angeles
summary: Officials said that Jonathan Rinderknecht, 29, of Melbourne, Fla., had intentionally set a fire that rekindled a week later into a devastating blaze that killed 12 people.

title: Who is Jonathan Rinderknecht? What We Know About The Palisades Fire Arrest
summary: Federal officials arrested a man they said started a small blaze in January that later rekindled and grew into the fire that devastated Pacific Palisades.

title: James Comey, Former FBI Director, Pleads Not Guilty and Will Seek to Dismiss Charges as Vindictive
summary: The former F.B.I. director appeared in a brief hearing in federal court. His lawyers sought clarity on the details of a case filed under pressure from President Trump.

title: Comey’s Two Legal Challenges to His Indictment, Explained
summary: A lawyer for the former F.B.I. director said he would accuse the Justice Department of malicious and selective prosecution and contend that a U.S. attorney was illegally appointed.

summary: As the federal closure slides into a second week, Republicans are working to peel off five more Democratic senators to join them in voting to reopen the government.

summary: A pair of Democratic senators confronted the Republican speaker of the House over his refusal to swear in a colleague during the shutdown.

summary: Online skeptics wondered if Mr. Miller had caught himself saying something he did not mean to. CNN says there was a technical glitch.

title: How Zohran Mamdani Came to Embrace the Palestinian Cause
summary: As Mr. Mamdani seeks to reassure New York City he is open to compromise, his views on Israel and Palestinians have been the biggest exception.

summary: Zohran Mamdani, the leading candidate in the race to be New York City’s next mayor, held a campaign event on a bus that crawled across Midtown Manhattan to highlight a signature proposal.

summary: Twenty-two people in a broad spectrum of the arts and sciences were awarded the fellowship, which comes with an $800,000 stipend.

title: What Civil Society Can Do to Beat Trumpism
summary: People and institutions of civil society must coordinate against him.

title: Radosław Sikorski: Putin Is Escalating His War
summary: The leadership of Russia must understand that its attempt to rebuild Europe’s last empire is doomed to fail.

title: Posts Calling Luigi Mangione Guilty Did No Harm, Top U.S. Prosecutor Argues
summary: A judge had demanded an explanation for why Justice Department officials were publicly expressing views on Luigi Mangione’s guilt in the killing of a health insurance executive.

summary: Many residents say that illegal dumping has inundated Oakland, Calif., a city with more garbage than almost anywhere else.

title: Texts from Jay Jones, Democratic Attorney General Candidate, Roil Virginia Governor’s Race
summary: In the messages, the Democratic candidate for attorney general, Jay Jones, discusses the hypothetical killing of a Republican lawmaker.

summary: The pope conveyed the message as President Trump escalated his deportation campaign, including in Chicago, the pope’s hometown.
